title: Multi-role Authentication Success
description: Verify that users across all roles (Faculty, Exam Cell, TC Admin, TC Head, Assessment Agency) can login successfully with correct credentials including OTP verification.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter valid username/email and password for each role one by one.
Perform OTP verification when prompted.
Click the login button.
Verify the user is logged in and directed to the correct dashboard per role.

title: Authentication Failure with Incorrect Credentials
description: Verify that login fails when an incorrect username, password, or OTP is provided.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter invalid username/email or password.
Enter incorrect OTP if requested.
Click the login button.
Verify that login is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed.

title: Role-based Access Control for Exam Schedule Visibility
description: Verify exam schedules are visible only according to user roles and schedule statuses, adhering to access filter rules.

steps.description: Login as Faculty and view exam schedules.
Verify Faculty can see only their own created schedules with statuses draft, submitted, rejected, and approved if allowed.
Login as Exam Cell and view exam schedules.
Verify Exam Cell can see schedules submitted by Faculty and pending their approval.
Login as TC Admin / TC Head and view schedules approved by Exam Cell.
Verify TC Admin/Head can see only Exam Cell approved schedules for further approval actions.
Login as Assessment Agency and view schedules.
Verify Assessment Agency sees only final submissions approved by TC with appropriate permissions.

title: Exam Schedule Approval Workflow Transitions
description: Verify that the exam schedule status changes follow the defined workflow and only authorized roles can perform actions based on status.

steps.description: Faculty creates schedule and saves as draft.
Verify the schedule status is 'draft'.
Faculty submits schedule.
Verify status changes to 'submitted' and email notification is sent to Exam Cell.
Exam Cell approves the schedule.
Verify status changes to 'approved', notification sent to TC Admin/Head.
TC Admin/Head rejects the schedule.
Verify status changes to 'rejected', notification sent to Faculty with reason.
TC Admin/Head holds the schedule.
Verify status changes to 'hold', appropriate notification is triggered.
Assessment Agency gives final approval.
Verify final approval status, email notification sent, and file number is generated correctly.
Any unauthorized role tries to change schedule status.
Verify the action is blocked with clear error message.

title: File Number Generation on Final Approval
description: Verify unique, formatted 18-character file numbers are generated correctly on final approval by Assessment Agency including correct financial year and incrementing serial number.

steps.description: Obtain an exam schedule approved by TC Admin/Head for final approval.
Assessment Agency approves the exam schedule finally.
Verify a unique 18-char file number is assigned.
Verify file number contains the current financial year and serial number increments properly.
Submit another schedule for final approval.
Verify a new unique serial file number increments correctly.

title: Email Notification on Schedule Status Changes
description: Verify that professional templated emails are sent automatically on schedule submission, approval (Exam Cell, TC Admin/Head), rejection, hold, and final approval.

steps.description: Submit exam schedule as Faculty.
Verify Exam Cell receives submission notification email with correct details.
Exam Cell approves schedule.
Verify TC Admin/Head and Faculty receive approval notification emails correctly.
TC Admin/Head rejects schedule.
Verify Faculty receives rejection email with reason.
Assessment Agency final approves schedule.
Verify all related users receive final approval notification with file number.

title: Protected Content Viewing â€“ Image and Signature URL Protection
description: Verify sensitive images like signatures are served via protected URLs with session token validation, no caching, and anti-copy mechanisms applied including canvas conversions.

steps.description: Login with valid credentials and open exam schedule view containing sensitive signature images.
Verify image URLs require valid session tokens, invalid sessions cannot access images.
Verify HTTP headers prevent caching of the protected images.
Verify images are rendered using canvas or equivalent method to prevent direct copying or saving.
Attempt to access image URLs from unauthorized sessions or direct browser navigation.
Verify access is denied with appropriate error or redirection to login.

title: JavaScript Page Protection against Developer Tools and Shortcuts
description: Verify that right-click context menu, keyboard shortcuts (such as Ctrl+Shift+I, F12), copy, paste, drag actions are blocked consistently across supported browsers and security alerts/logs are generated.

steps.description: Open any exam schedule or sensitive content page.
Attempt to open developer tools using standard shortcuts (F12, Ctrl+Shift+I, Ctrl+Shift+J).
Verify the shortcut is blocked and developer tools do not open or functional.
Attempt to right-click on page content.
Verify right-click context menu is disabled.
Attempt to copy, paste, or drag content using keyboard shortcuts and mouse actions.
Verify these operations are blocked and user is notified or no action occurs.
Verify security alert email is sent and logs are captured for these events.

title: Bulk Student Data Upload with Date Format and Null Value Fixes
description: Verify bulk student data upload accepts various date formats (including DD-MM-YYYY), converts them properly to MySQL format, handles empty columns, applies default values, and logs errors or fixes.

steps.description: Prepare bulk upload CSV with mixed date formats, empty/null columns, and invalid entries.
Perform bulk upload via student import interface.
Verify date fields are normalized to MySQL date format without errors.
Verify empty or null columns for key fields are assigned default/fallback values.
Verify invalid records are either rejected with logged error messages or handled gracefully according to logic.
Verify upload logs record all fixes and errors accurately.

title: Secure PDF and File Serving with Access Control
description: Verify stored PDF files and images are served through secure custom routes enforcing access control, correct MIME types, and inline display rendering.

steps.description: Login as authorized user and request a PDF exam schedule file.
Verify the file is served inline with correct Content-Type (application/pdf) and no download prompts if configured.
Request the same file URL from an unauthorized user or without authentication.
Verify access is denied and redirected to login page with clear message.
Request protected image URLs similarly.
Verify secure serving with token validation and access restrictions.

title: Print Functionality with Temporary Protection Disable and Restoration
description: Verify that the print function opens native print dialog, disables content protections (such as canvas and shortcut blocks) during printing, and restores all protections after printing without errors.

steps.description: Open an approved exam schedule page.
Invoke the print function via the UI button.
Verify native print dialog opens.
Verify content protections are disabled to enable printing (e.g. canvas images render readable, keyboard shortcuts pass through).
Complete or cancel print dialog.
Verify all protections are restored correctly after print dialog closes.
Verify no error or UI glitches occur during or after printing.

title: Unauthorized Access Redirect and Error Message Display
description: Verify all unauthorized or invalid accesses to protected routes redirect the user to login page with clear, user-friendly messages, and no sensitive information leaks.

steps.description: Attempt accessing protected URLs (exam schedules, images, PDFs) without login or with expired session.
Verify automatic redirect to login page with message indicating session expiration or access denial.
Attempt actions not permitted by user role (e.g. Faculty trying to approve schedules).
Verify user is blocked and shown a clear error message or redirected appropriately.

title: Security Logging of Access Attempts and Email Sending States
description: Verify all relevant security events like login attempts, unauthorized access, developer tool usage attempts, and status of email notifications are logged accurately for audit purposes.

steps.description: Generate a set of login attempts including successful, failed, and brute force attempts.
Verify all login attempts are recorded with timestamps, IP, user agent, and status.
Trigger attempts to open developer tools or use forbidden shortcuts.
Verify these events are logged with details and security alert emails are sent.
Perform exam schedule status changes that cause email notifications.
Verify email sending successes or failures are logged appropriately.

title: Student Data Validation on Profile Creation and Editing
description: Verify data validations are enforced correctly when creating or editing student profiles, including mandatory fields, formats, and fallback/default values for optional or null fields.

steps.description: Attempt creating a student profile with missing mandatory fields like name, roll number.
Verify validation errors are shown, preventing submission.
Enter invalid data formats (e.g. dates, emails, phone numbers) and submit.
Verify appropriate validation error messages appear.
Create a student with null/empty optional fields.
Verify system assigns default or fallback values correctly and no errors occur.

title: TC Management Role-based Functionalities
description: Verify Training Centre management (centres, layouts, shot codes) is accessible only by authorized roles and supports full CRUD operations with validation.

steps.description: Login as TC Admin or TC Head.
Create, edit, view and delete TC Centres and layouts.
Verify all operations succeed with correct validations.
Attempt TC management access as Faculty or Exam Cell.
Verify access is denied for non-authorized roles.

title: Dashboard Data and Visualization Access per Role
description: Verify that dashboards display appropriate data and visualizations relevant to the logged-in user's role accurately.

steps.description: Login as Faculty and open dashboard.
Verify dashboard shows faculty-specific statistics, schedules, and charts.
Login as Exam Cell and open dashboard.
Verify dashboard shows Exam Cell related data such as pending approvals.
Repeat for TC Admin, TC Head, Assessment Agency.
Verify role-based data separation and accuracy in dashboard contents.
